author: mpetrunic
content: What about faucets? Isn't it a bit insecure to hand out 32 ethers? Should we do some faucet that will pay for deposit if you give him tx data?

author: jgm
content:
I'm thinking that it may be better to bring up another POA-type Ethereum test network just for handling deposit data; no worries about distributing Ether as the network can be shut down afterwards.

There are a few other options that could be considered if people wnat to stay on Goerli, but they depend on how much people care about allowing multiple deposits to take place easily.

author: terencechain
content: <@545555441518772225> we have a facet running on Goerli, anyone can request 3.2GoETH from our test net participate page

author: terencechain
content: Another thing to point out is we are using a demo testnet config that lowers deposit requirement and increases ejection threshold. The Eth1 follow distance is set to 16 from 1024

author: mpetrunic
content: <@363800010518822915> I know ðŸ™‚ But eventually, I think,  stable testnet should mimick mainnet params instead of custom configuration, right?

author: terencechain
content: Yea I agree. Those configs make it easier to bootstrap initially but we should move towards mainnet configs

author: terencechain
content: Luckily it's really easy to change them

author: terencechain
content: Happy to hear what others think
